sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"谷物"之意。
means: corn ： 主要指大麦、小麦、燕麦、裸麦、玉蜀黍这5种谷物及其粒子。
crop ： 指谷物或果类等一年或一季的收成，也可指地里的农业作物或谷物。
grain ： 指稻、麦等谷类及其粒子。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"收成"之意。
means: crop ： 普通用词，侧重指农作物一次收割或一季的收成。
harvest ： 主要指农作物或水果的收获量，有时也指收割的行为。
yield ： 指生产物，农作物的总产量。

word_mean: 嗉囊：暂时贮存食物的特殊区，在鸟类为颈下部之食管膨大，开始消化前在此经摄入水浸软食物，然后通过前胃进入砂囊。在某些无脊椎动物如昆虫和蚯蚓中也见到类似的器官

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to German Kropf. From Old English to the late 18th cent. there existed a sense 'flower head, ear of corn', giving rise to sense 1 and senses referring to the top of something, whence sense 3

encyclopedia.content: 直接或间接为人类需要而栽培的植物。“作物”一词由日语转借而来，在中国古籍中则称“禾稼”或“谷” 。古代有所谓“五谷”、“六谷”、“九谷”、以至“百谷”之称，其中谷的含义不断发展，由稻、黍稷、麦、菽，逐步扩大到麻类、瓜果、蔬菜乃至所有栽培植物。中国农业文献中自20世纪初开始引用“作物”一词，今已普及，俗称“庄稼”。

entry.def: Crops are plants such as wheat and potatoes that are grown in large quantities for food.

example.ex: Rice farmers here still plant and harvest their crops by hand...
example.tran: 这里种植水稻的农场主仍是人工种植和收割庄稼。

example.ex: The main crop is wheat and this is grown even on the very steep slopes.
example.tran: 主要作物是小麦，就连很陡的坡地都种上了小麦。

entry.def: The plants or fruits that are collected at harvest time are referred to as a crop .

example.ex: Each year it produces a fine crop of fruit...
example.tran: 这里每年水果都大丰收。

example.ex: The US government says that this year's corn crop should be about 8 percent more than last year...
example.tran: 美国政府称今年的玉米产量应该会比去年提高8%左右。

entry.tran: (在一起的)一群（人）;(同时发生的)一些（事情）
entry.def: You can refer to a group of people or things that have appeared together as a crop of people or things.

example.ex: The present crop of books and documentaries about Marilyn Monroe exploit the thirtieth anniversary of her death...
example.tran: 时下出现的这些有关玛丽莲·梦露的书和纪录片是借她逝世30周年之际推出的。

example.ex: Next year's crop of undergraduates opting to take physics represents just 2 per cent of all undergraduates.
example.tran: 明年选修物理的大学生仅占大学生总数的2%。

entry.def: When a plant crops, it produces fruits or parts which people want.

example.ex: Although these vegetables adapt well to our temperate climate, they tend to crop poorly.
example.tran: 虽然这些蔬菜作物很适应我们这里温和的气候，它们的收成却很差。

entry.def: When you crop something that you have planted, you collect the fruits or parts that you want from it.

example.ex: I started cropping my beans in July.
example.tran: 我7月份开始收割豆类作物。

entry.def: When an animal such as a cow or horse crops leaves or plants, it eats them.

example.ex: I let the horse drop his head to crop the spring grass.
example.tran: 我让马低下头啃吃春天的青草。

entry.def: To crop someone's hair means to cut it short.

example.ex: She cropped her hair and dyed it blonde.
example.tran: 她把头发剪短并染成了金黄色。

entry.def: A crop is a short hairstyle.

example.ex: She had her long hair cut into a boyish crop.
example.tran: 她把长发剪成了男孩子般的短发。

entry.def: If you crop a photograph, you cut part of it off, in order to get rid of part of the picture or to be able to frame it.

example.ex: I decided to crop the picture just above the water line...
example.tran: 我决定把这张照片水印以下的部分裁掉。

example.ex: Her husband was cropped from the photograph.
example.tran: 她丈夫被从照片上剪下去了。

means.word_mean: 1. the yield from plants in a single growing season
2. a collection of people or things appearing together;

sentences.sentence: "the annual crop of students brings a new crop of ideas"

means.word_mean: 3. the output of something in a season;

sentences.sentence: "the latest crop of fashions is about to hit the stores"

means.word_mean: 4. the stock or handle of a whip
5. a pouch in many birds and some lower animals that resembles a stomach for storage and preliminary maceration of food
4. let feed in a field or pasture or meadow
5. feed as in a meadow or pasture;
6. cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of;

auth_sentence.res_content: Obama and his ilk are a crop of lawyers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Obama and his ilk are a crop of lawyers.

auth_sentence.res_content: In Senegal, peanuts are the main cash crop.

Sentence.sentence: One acre of farmland use to for crop production can produce 1,500 pounds of tomatoes.
Better irrigation can dramatically improve crop yield and about 40% of the world's food supply is currently derived from irrigated land

This case gives the court an opportunity to rein in the growing use of patents to protect genetically engineered crops and other life forms―but the court may well use it to give this trend a powerful new endorsement.

sentences.en: She asked the barber to crop her hair short.
sentences.cn: 她叫理发师把她的头发剪短了。

sentences.en: The land on hilltops and hillsides was all cropped.
sentences.cn: 山顶和山坡上的地全都种了庄稼。

sentences.en: This plant doesn't crop very heavily.

jushi.english: There is a large crop of mistakes in your essay.
jushi.chinese: 你的文章里有许多错误。

jushi.english: We grow a variety of crops, including cabbages, wheat and barley.
jushi.chinese: 我们种多种农作物,包白括菜、小麦和大麦。

jushi.english: The soil, poor and alkaline, produced feeble crops.
jushi.chinese: 在贫瘠的碱性土壤里庄稼长得不壮。
